advance.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a change, discovery, or invention that brings progress
advance.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the advances made in the understanding of mental handicap
one of the great technological advances of the 20th century
Recent advances in genetics have raised moral questions.
advance.translation[0].definitions[1].de: forward movement or progress of a group of people – used especially to talk about soldiers
advance.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: the enemy’s advance on St. Petersburg
advance.translation[0].definitions[2].de: money paid to someone before the usual time, especially someone’s salary
advance.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Krebs decided to ask for an advance on his salary.
advance.translation[0].definitions[3].de: an increase in the price or value of something – used especially when talking about the stock exchange
advance.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers
advance.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
Troops advanced on the rebel stronghold  (=moved towards it in order to attack it).
The army advanced across the plain.
advance.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if scientific or technical knowledge advances, or if something advances it, it develops and improves
advance.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Our understanding of human genetics has advanced considerably.
The group’s research has done much to advance our knowledge of the HIV virus.
advance.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to give someone money before they have earned it
advance.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Will they advance you some money until you get your first paycheck?
I advanced $1,500 to Kramer last Thursday.
advance.translation[1].definitions[3].de: if the price or value of something advances, it increases – used especially when talking about the stock exchange
advance.translation[1].definitions[4].de: to change the time or date when an event should happen to an earlier time or date
advance.translation[1].definitions[4].ex: The meeting has been advanced to ten o'clock.
advance.translation[1].definitions[5].de: if you advance a film, clock, musical recording etc, or if it advances, it goes forward
advance.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: A small fee is charged for this service and advance notice of at least two weeks is required.
A fair-minded employer will usually give employees plenty ofadvance warning of possible redundancies.
advance.translation[4].definitions[0].de: an amount of money paid to someone before the usual time, or before a piece of work has been completed
advance.translation[4].definitions[0].ex: We could offer you an advance of £1,000 and the rest on satisfactory completion of the book.
He had received an advance on his wages.
advance.translation[4].definitions[1].de: an increase in the amount, level, or price of something
advance.translation[4].definitions[1].ex: UK stocks have risen sharply, with further advances expected.
Analysts forecast a 6% decline in Italian car sales and an 8% advance in French sales.
advance.translation[5].definitions[0].de: if you advance someone money, you lend it to them or give it to them, perhaps before they have earned it
advance.translation[5].definitions[0].ex: Patrons advanced sums of money for building an art gallery.
Random House had advanced him the money to write a book.
advance.translation[5].definitions[1].de: when the price of shares, currencies, goods etc advances, it increases
advance.translation[5].definitions[1].ex: Gold prices advanced slightly in early trading.
The dollar advanced against the yen.
advance.translation[5].definitions[2].de: when profits or sales advance, they increase
advance.translation[5].definitions[3].de: when a company advances, its profit increases
advance.translation[5].definitions[3].ex: The company advanced 19.5%, lifting net profits to 1.25 billion rupees.
